sentences.en: a desk-bound sergeant (=  having to work in an office, instead of doing a more active job  )
sentences.cn: 被困于案头工作的警官

sentences.en: a fog-bound airport
sentences.cn: 因大雾而关闭的机场

sentences.en: democracy is bound up with a measure of economic and social equality.
sentences.cn: 民主与经济和社会平等程度有着密切关系。

sentences.en: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.cn: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.en: For example, if we are in jobs where we feel bound, in sacrifice, because it is something we have to do, all of the fun and capacity to receive is gone.
sentences.cn: 举例来说，如果我们在工作里面感到受限制，在牺牲，这是因为有些事情我们必须得做，所有的喜悦、享受、接受的能力都因此没有了。

sentences.en: His comments are bound to add fuel to the debate.
sentences.cn: 他的话必将为争论推波助澜。

sentences.en: his kitchen was &B{out of bounds to} me at mealtimes.
sentences.cn: 用餐时间，我不得进他的厨房。

sentences.en: I'll show it to Benjamin. He's bound to know.
sentences.cn: 我会把它给本杰明看，他肯定会知道。

sentences.en: I'm bound to say that I have some doubts.
sentences.cn: 我有责任告诉大家我有些疑问。

sentences.en: Ian felt bound to tell Joanna the truth.
sentences.cn: 伊恩觉得有责任告诉乔安娜真相。

sentences.en: If they are unemployed it's bound to breed resentment.
sentences.cn: 如果他们失去工作，一定会产生怨恨。

sentences.en: Mark’s problems are all bound up with his mother’s death when he was ten.
sentences.cn: 马克的问题和他十岁丧母有很大的关系。

sentences.en: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances, but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.--James Allen
sentences.cn: 人们总是渴望改善周遭环境，但是却不愿意改善自己，因此总停留在原地，无法进步。

sentences.en: people who are wheelchair-bound
sentences.cn: 离不开轮椅的人

sentences.en: she was too bound up in her own misery to care that other people were hurt.
sentences.cn: 她沉迷于自己的痛苦之中无法自拔，根本没去想别人是否受到伤害。

sentences.en: she's hatching more little plots, I'll be bound!.
sentences.cn: 我敢肯定她正在策划更多的小阴谋！。

sentences.en: The authorities will be legally bound to arrest any suspects.
sentences.cn: 当局负有逮捕所有疑犯的法律责任。

sentences.en: The ethnic populations are so intermingled that there's bound to be conflict.
sentences.cn: 各民族人口如此杂居，肯定会发生冲突。

sentences.en: The King's stand is bound to reawaken the painful debate about abortion.
sentences.cn: 国王的立场必然会再次引发关于堕胎的令人头痛的辩论。

sentences.en: Their interests were completely bound up in their careers.
sentences.cn: 他们的兴趣完全是围绕着他们的职业。

sentences.en: There are bound to be price increases next year.
sentences.cn: 明年物价一定会上涨。

sentences.en: There are bound to be teething problems with something so new.
sentences.cn: 如此新鲜的事物刚开始必然会有些问题。

sentences.en: This case was bound to get entangled in international politics.
sentences.cn: 这件事肯定会在国际政坛上纠缠不清。

sentences.en: This episode is bound to be a deep embarrassment for Washington.
sentences.cn: 这一事件肯定会让华盛顿非常难堪。

sentences.en: We are all bound by the inevitability of death.
sentences.cn: 我们早晚都会有一死。

sentences.en: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.cn: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

sentences.en: With one bound Jack was free.
sentences.cn: 杰克纵身一跃就脱身了。

sentences.en: You are legally bound to report the accident.
sentences.cn: 法律上你有责任报告这起事故。

sentences.en: You should bound your desires by reason.
sentences.cn: 你应以理性来限制你的欲望。

sentences.en: You're bound to mistime a tackle every so often.
sentences.cn: 有时候你肯定会错估铲球的时机。

words.tran_cn: 保镖；巨大的东西；跳跃的人；吹牛者
有义务的；受约束的；装有封面的

phrases.tran_cn: 与…合订；与…有共同的境界；（因喜悦等而）雀跃
有责任（做某事）；感到应该
有责任（做某事）；感到应该
拓展训练；驶出的；开往国外的

trans.tran_cn: 一定会，注定会，紧密相连的，准备前往…的
trans.tran_en: to be forced to do what a law or agreement says you must do
a long or high jump made with a lot of energy

trans.tran_cn: （bind的过去式和过去分词）使紧密联系，约束，捆绑，装订
trans.tran_en: to run with a lot of energy, because you are happy, excited, or frightened
to run with a lot of energy, because you are happy, excited, or frightened
to run with a lot of energy, because you are happy, excited, or frightened
